title: How to Remove Email Contacts from an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. It’s an app on one of your home screens (possibly in a folder called “Utilities”) that has a gray cog icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Contacts.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Contacts . It’s in the fifth group of settings.

steps.title: Select the account with unwanted contacts.
steps.content: Select the account with unwanted contacts. For example, if you don’t want to see your Outlook Mail contacts on your iPhone, select “Outlook.”

steps.title: Move the “Contacts” switch to the Off position.
steps.content: Move the “Contacts” switch to the Off position.

steps.title: Tap Delete from My iPhone.
steps.content: Tap Delete from My iPhone . The contacts from that account will no longer appear on your iPhone. You can re-sync these contacts at any time by moving the "Contacts" switch back to the On position.
